me.tatarka.ipromise.task

Class ThreadTask<T>

  • java.lang.Object
    • me.tatarka.ipromise.task.ThreadTask<T>
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    Task<T>

    public class ThreadTask<T>
extends java.lang.Object
implements Task<T>
    A Task that executes using a single Thread. If the Promise is canceled, Thread.interrupt() is called. This is particularly useful for IO operations.

    • Nested Class Summary

      • Nested classes/interfaces inherited from interface me.tatarka.ipromise.task.Task

        Task.Do<T>, Task.DoMany<T>, Task.DoManyFailable<T,E extends java.lang.Exception>, Task.DoOnce<T>, Task.DoOnceFailable<T,E extends java.lang.Exception>, Task.Sender<T>

      • start

        public Promise<T> start()
        Description copied from interface: Task
        Starts the async operation. This method is expected to return immediately, running the operation asynchronously.
        Specified by:
        start in interface Task<T>
        Returns:
        an Promise to manage the operation's result.
